Basscss / Docs

Base

Base element styles control native HTML elements such as headings, paragraphs, buttons, and forms in a systematic and opinionated way. These styles include typographical considerations and utilities derived from base elements, such as typefaces, the type scale, forms, and buttons.

Typography

Base type scale

Base type elements are normalized to a simple type scale that works well across devices.

Type scale utilities

Use the .h1 â€“ .h6 font-size utilities to override an elements defaults.

Forms

Forms use default base styles for their structural appearance and thematic styles for colors and borders. This creates a rhythmic consitency among all forms while allowing thematic differences where needed. Form elements do not rely on nested styles or markup structure, so utility styles can be used for contextual adjustments.

Inline Forms

By default, form elements are display inline. Use the default .input theme or create custom themes to control the look.

Stacked Forms

Use .block and other utilities to stack form elements. This allows for a lot of flexibility with form layouts.

Buttons

Base button styles are defined in base. Use themes and extensions to alter the default look.

Tables

Default table structural styles are defined in base. Use the default table-light theme for minimal styling or create custom theme extensions.
